title: Tyler County, Texas
text:
Tyler County is a <a href="County%20%28United%20States%29">county</a> located in the <a href="U.S.%20state">U.S. state</a> of <a href="Texas">Texas</a>. As of the <a href="2010%20United%20States%20Census">2010 census</a>, its population was 21,766. Its <a href="county%20seat">seat</a> is <a href="Woodville%2C%20Texas">Woodville</a>. Tyler County is named for <a href="John%20Tyler">John Tyler</a>, the 10th <a href="President%20of%20the%20United%20States">President of the United States</a>.
Despite its name, Tyler County does not contain the city of <a href="Tyler%2C%20Texas">Tyler, Texas</a>; the latter is located about 140 miles to the north in <a href="Smith%20County%2C%20Texas">Smith County</a>.
Geography.
According to the <a href="U.S.%20Census%20Bureau">U.S. Census Bureau</a>, the county has a total area of , of which are land and (1.2%) are covered by water.
Demographics.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2000, 20,871 people, 7,775 households, and 5,675 families resided in the county. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was 23 people per square mile (9/km2). The 10,419 housing units averaged 11 per square mile (4/km2). The <a href="Race%20%28United%20States%20Census%29">racial makeup</a> of the county was 84.0% White, 12.0% African American, 0.4% Native American, 0.2% Asian, 2.52% from other races, and 1.1% from two or more races. About 3.6% of the population was Hispanic or Latino of any race.
Of the 7,775 households, 29.7% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 60.1% were married couples living together, 10.0% had a female householder with no husband present, and 27.0% were not families. About 24.3% of all households were made up of individuals, and 12.4% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.5 and the average family size was 2.9.
In the county, the population was distributed as 23.2% under the age of 18, 8.0% from 18 to 24, 27.2% from 25 to 44, 23.8% from 45 to 64, and 17.8% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 39 years. For every 100 females, there were 106.9 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 108.2 males.
The median income for a household in the county was $29,808, and for a family was $35,195. Males had a median income of $31,797 versus $19,594 for females. The <a href="per%20capita%20income">per capita income</a> for the county was $15,367. About 12.6% of families and 15.8% of the population were below the <a href="poverty%20line">poverty line</a>, including 21.0% of those under age 18 and 10.1% of those age 65 or over.
Education.
School districts:
The county is in the service area of <a href="Angelina%20College">Angelina College</a>.
